TopicTitle: Found a bug, don't need help, just wanted to share it.

Articles.Content:
So i was messing around in the VAB a little *too* much with offset and symmetry tools, and it broke a bit, so i went out to the space center intending to reload the VAB scene, when i was greeted by this:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/dvwi3trkkgbd0oj/screenshot11.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/dvwi3trkkgbd0oj/screenshot11.png?dl=0)

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/hpqqi8cinb5rsh2/screenshot12.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/hpqqi8cinb5rsh2/screenshot12.png?dl=0)

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/uufwm02oaix89rn/screenshot14.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/uufwm02oaix89rn/screenshot14.png?dl=0)

![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)
Very strange indeed. It looks like some kind of vector gradient, but of what?

Oh, I've had that glitch before. I think you just pressed the wrong button, because I believe those markers have something to do with the terrain. Restarting the game should fix it.![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

This is a debugging feature of the Kopernicus mod. I presume you have an older version installed which uses Ctrl-S to show the markers and Ctrl-C to get rid of them. These keys were changed to Mod-; and Mod-/ to make it harder to hit them by accident.
